com.googlecode.lanterna.gui

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.lanterna.gui.Window
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionListDialog, FileDialog, MessageBox, TextInputDialog, WaitingDialog

    public class Window
extends Object
    The Window class is the basis for Lanternas GUI system. The workflow is to create and show modal windows and promt the user for input. A window, once displayed, will take over control by entering an event loop and won't come back until the window is closed.
    Author:
    Martin

        Returns the current window size override or null if none is set
        Returns:
        Override for the window size or null

      • setWindowSizeOverride

        public void setWindowSizeOverride(TerminalSize windowSizeOverride)
        Sets the size of the window to a fixed value, rather than using automatic size calculation. If you call this method with windowSizeOverride parameter set to null, the automatic size calculation will be activated again.
        Parameters:
        windowSizeOverride - Size the window should have, or null if you want to use automatic size calculation

      • addEmptyLine

        @Deprecated
public void addEmptyLine()
        Deprecated. 
        Don't use the method, call addComponent(new EmptySpace(1, 1)) instead

      • setSoloWindow

        public void setSoloWindow(boolean soloWindow)
        If set to true, when this window is shown, all previous windows are hidden. Set to false to show them again.
